N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 78.3 - Prohibitions

State Regulations
(a) No person, except those authorized by the Department of Public Utilities of the City of

Troy or the Department of Environmental Conservation, shall trespass, for any
purpose whatsoever, in any area posted with "restricted area" signs. (b) No person shall fish or trespass outside
areas posted with restricted area signs, unless they are fishing under permit, have a special permit, or are accompanying someone who is fishing under
permit. (c) No person shall fail to
carry his permit on his person when in the cooperator area, or shall fail to
show his permit to a Department of Public Utilities of the City of Troy
representative or other duly authorized official. (d) No person in violation of this Part shall
fail to surrender his permit upon request to the department employee or
authorized official in whose presence the violation takes place. Such permittee
shall immediately leave the cooperator area property and not enter thereupon
until his permit is reinstated. (e) No person shall fail to comply with all regulatory signs posted by the

Department of Environmental Conservation in the area. (f) No person shall hunt, litter, build
fires, wade, swim, bathe, picnic, operate a boat except for City of Troy
approved boats, or snowmobile, erect any hut, tent, or ice fishing shanty, damage or molest fences, gates, equipment, trees or other property, or disturb
persons who may be working in the area. (g) No person shall possess any cans or
bottles, in the area except at a parked vehicle. (h) No person shall deposit human excreta, refuse, or radioactive or hazardous material on or beneath the surface of the
ground or water or ice at any point in the area. (i) No person shall discharge, apply or allow
any herbicide, pesticide or toxic chemical to enter into the reservoir or any
watercourse in the area. (j) No
person shall take fish other than by angling during the open water-season and
then only within the designated area and pursuant to a fishing
permit. (k) No person shall take
fish other than by angling or tip-ups during the ice fishing season and then
only within the designated area and pursuant to a fishing permit. (l) No person shall use any chemicals such as
antifreeze, salt, or petroleum products to keep ice fishing holes
open. (m) No person shall possess
or use on the ice of the reservoir any power auger, other machines or
mechanical devices, nor possess gasoline or other fuel. (n) The Department of Public Utilities of the

City of Troy and the Department of Environmental Conservation reserve the right
to eject any person from the area for disorderly conduct, intoxication or any
other behavior which endangers the general safety or health of persons in the
area. (o) Except as otherwise
provided in this Part, no person in the area shall fail to comply with all
applicable provisions of: (1)
the

Environmental Conservation Law; and
(2)
orders of the Department of Environmental

Conservation with respect to open seasons, size limits and catch
limits. Notes
